section.title: Build Flickcurl library and flickcurl utility
section.para: Add the utils directory to your shell search path:
section.programlisting: $ PATH=`pwd`/utils:$PATH on bourne shells such as Bash or $ setenv PATH `pwd`/utils:$PATH on c shells such as tcsh
section.para: You should get an error if you now try the utility:
section.programlisting: $ flickcurl photos.getInfo 1234567 flickcurl: ERROR: No shared secret flickcurl: Command photos.getInfo failed
section.para: This is because there is no configuration set for the library. For the flickcurl utility, it reads the configuration from a file ~/.flickcurl.conf which contains parameters used for authentication. This section describes how those parameters are obtained.

section.title: Register application to get API Key and Shared Secret
section.para: NOTE: In the pictures below, the Flickr web site is shown in English and the screenshots taken in early December 2009. Flickr upgrade the web site often so these instructions may not match the latest look. Hopefully you can figure it out!
Start by navigating to the Flickr App Garden at http://www.flickr.com/services/ and follow the link 'Create an App' taking you to http://www.flickr.com/services/apps/create/

caption.para: Flickr App Garden - Get your API Key

section.para: Select the link 'Request an API Key' taking you to http://www.flickr.com/services/apps/create/apply/
Select either of the two buttons: 'Apply for a Non-Commercial Key' or 'Apply for a Commercial Key' as appropriate.
Fill in the form fields and submit it via the 'Submit' button.

caption.para: Flickr App Garden - Key and Secret

section.para: Flickr will return a page containing both the API Key that looks something like:
and Secret which looks something like:

These strings should be used for the values of the api and secret keys in either the ~/.flickcurl.conf if used with the flickcurl utility or in code, with the flickcurl_set_api_key() and flickcurl_set_shared_secret() functions.
You now need to change the key to be of type mobile since no callback URL is usually appropriate for a command-line application or library.
Click the 'Edit auth flow for this app' link below the Key and Secret

caption.para: Flickr App Garden - Edit authentication flow

section.para: Change the 'App Type' to 'Mobile Application' then set the 'Mobile Permissions' to 'Read', 'Write' Or 'Delete' as appropriate.

caption.para: Flickr App Garden - Edit authentication flow: mobile

section.para: This sequence will make the new key 'Auth mode Mobile' and an authentication URL will be shown on the same page and look something like this:
Finish with the 'Save Changes' button to confirm and return you to the application page.
If you ever need to alter or view the authentication, use the link 'Edit the authentication flow' on right-hand side of the application page.
All your Flickr applications are linked from http://www.flickr.com/services/apps/by/me

section.title: Getting Authentication Token from API Key and Secret
section.para: Create a file ~/.flickcurl.conf with the two values above (API Key, Shared Secret) like this:
Then visit the Authentication URL mentioned in the previous section (http://www.flickr.com/auth-11111111111111111) in a web browser.
Flickr will return a page that says something like:
section.programlisting: "[APP NAME] wants to link to your Flickr account"
section.para: with more information and two buttons. Click the button with the text:
Flickr will return on the next page a 9-digit FROB that looks like this:
Switch back to the command line and run the flickcurl utility with that FROB:
The result will be that an Authentication Token (auth token) is calculated and returned. The flickcurl utility will reply:
section.programlisting: flickcurl: Successfully exchanged frob 123-456-789 for authentication token flickcurl: Updated configuration file /Users/NAME/.flickcurl.conf with authentication token
section.para: The flickcurl utility has automatically updated the ~/.flickcurl.conf configuration file (as the message will show) with the auth_token field to give something like:
At this stage, the utility (or library) is authenticated and ready to use.

section.title: Use flickcurl
section.para: Now the configuration has been created and authentication completed, the library and utility will work.
section.programlisting: $ flickcurl photos.getInfo 1234567 flickcurl: Found photo with URI http://www.flickr.com/photos/yogi/1234567/ ID 1234567 and 1 tags ...
